SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Serve a Bot-Enabled Product List Page and Product Detail Page

To make it easier for search engine bots to index your categories, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now serves a bot-enabled Product List page for category results. Also, to improve the amount of product content that bots can index, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now serves more information on the bot-enabled Product Detail page. These changes also improve link equity across your storefront pages, which boosts the SEO ranking of your products and categories in external search results.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce served only a bot-enabled Product Detail page, which included content for only the product and its related products. The bot-enabled Product Detail page excluded any content from components on the page, such as the header or category tree.

Now, both the bot-enabled Product List page and Product Detail pages include content from the following components:

Header
Menu
Breadcrumbs
Category tree
Footer

The bot-enabled Product List page also includes paginated results. Each page in the paginated set includes metadata that relates that page to its siblings. This metadata helps an external search engine understand that each bot-enabled Product List page that it crawls is part of a set of related results.

NOTE
The bot-enabled Product List page applies only to category results.
Only version 2.0 of the Product List page supports the bot-enabled page.
The bot-enabled Product List page for category results is limited to the first 2000 products assigned to the category.
The bot-enabled Product List page sorts results only by Sequence. If storefront users sort the standard Product List page by any other value, the results on your bot-enabled page don’t match your standard page.

How: When you enable bot detection, the bot-enabled pages are available on your storefront immediately—no extra setup is necessary. You also get content from the header, menu, breadcrumbs, and category tree for free!

But, to show bot-enabled footer content, create a CC Rich Contents record with the ContentKey static_footer_seo for each storefront.
